page.title: 01GENERAL VIEW OF GODMERSHAM
page.content: This is an area of outstanding natural beauty. There are two main areas of population. Godmersham is a tiny kentish hamlet hidden away off the A28 Ashford to Canterbury road which follows the Stour river valley, and Mountain Street a handful of houses on the eastern side of a lane leading from Chilham to Challock Forest. The rest are scattered farmhouses.The land itself is either agricultural, forest or coppiced beech. There are no shops, inns or schools and farming is the only employment in the area. There is a strong spirit of neighbourly help which more than makes up for the lack of amenities. All the local people fight together to save their valley from threat of development and to conserve their heritage.
